startup_prompt: [review] Resuming Epic 3: Standards and automation of atomic rules, handoff and context transfer. Status: automation phase completed with full handoff validation system. Infrastructure: FastAPI endpoints (POST /handoff/validate, GET /handoff/template), CLI tool (handoff_cli.py), atomic rules updated including 016_context_transfer_protocol. Lessons: structured validation critical for handoff quality, testing real workflow more important than infrastructure alone. Constraints: must maintain .mdc_ work protocol, complete documentation before rule finalization. Next: validate real-world usage, integrate with CI/CD, complete documentation phase.
control_questions: What is current Epic 3 status and what automation components have been implemented?
What technical components (API, CLI, validators) are ready for testing and how do they work?
What scope constraints must be maintained including .mdc_ work protocol requirements?
How should the handoff validation workflow be integrated with existing CI/CD processes?
What are the immediate next steps for completing Epic 3 and validating real workflow?
success_criteria: Handoff package validates with 80%+ completeness score using real files
